title: The Exploration Company Opens New HQ in Oberpfaffenhofen
summary:
In-space logistics startup The Exploration Company has opened its new headquarters in Oberpfaffenhofen, Germany, with operations at the facility expected to begin in December. Founded in 2021, The Exploration Company is developing a modular, reusable spacecraft called Nyx, which will initially be used to transport cargo to and from the International Space Station. Planned future […]

title: An in-space construction firm says it can help build massive data centers in orbit
Inside the new age of space domain awareness
summary:
In this episode of Space Minds, host David Ariosto speaks with Doug Hendrix, co-founder and CEO of ExoAnalytic Solutions — a company born from three physicists’ passion for solving the hardest problems in space.

title: Momentus Vigoride-7 to fly DPhi Space hosted payload platform
summary:
MOUNTAIN VIEW, California — Momentus announced a partnership Oct. 30 with DPhi Space to fly Swiss startup’s hosted-payload platform early next year. Momentus will host the DPhi Space Clustergate-2 payload, which is designed to turn a host spacecraft into a “high-performance hub” on the Vigoride 7 spacecraft, according to the news release. By working with […]

title: Confronting China’s pervasive maritime gray zone campaign
summary:
China’s persistent use of maritime gray zone tactics poses a fundamental challenge to regional stability and the international order. These actions are designed to achieve strategic aims — territorial advancement and sovereignty erosion — without crossing the threshold of conventional armed conflict. Using ambiguity and indirect coercion, China seeks to “advance without attacking” and shape […]

title: Former NASA Administrators urge space agency to rethink plans for Artemis Moon lander
summary: The comments came during a fireside chat featuring former NASA administrators, Charlie Bolden and Jim Bridenstine, at the conclusion of the American Astronautical Society’s 2025 von Braun Space Exploration Symposium in Huntsville, Alabama.

title: China targets 2026 for first Long March 10 launch, new lunar crew spacecraft flight
summary:
China aims to conduct the first launch of its Long March 10 rocket and a lunar-capable crew spacecraft next year, according to a top official.
The post China targets 2026 for first Long March 10 launch, new lunar crew spacecraft flight appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Former NASA administrators call for changes in Artemis lunar lander architecture
summary:
Two former NASA administrators criticized the agency’s current use of SpaceX’s Starship for the Artemis 3 crewed lunar landing, calling for an urgent redirection to reach the moon before China.
The post Former NASA administrators call for changes in Artemis lunar lander architecture appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Sentinel-1D pre-launch media briefing
summary: Follow the online briefing on the launch scheduled for 4 November 2025. The Copernicus Sentinel-1 mission delivers radar images of Earth’s surface. It is vital for disaster response teams, environmental agencies, maritime authorities, climate scientists.
